> When you look at the big picture, the two establishment parties are
> almost exactly alike. A few years back during the Clinton
> administration, there was a huge fight over the budget. There was talk
> of the government experiencing a temporary "shutdown" because the two
> sides couldn't agree. Guess how much of a difference in the federal
> budget the Republicans and Democrats were fighting over? Four percent!
> In the big picture this is practically nothing!
>
> Republican politicians talk a good game of being fiscally prudent and
> standing up for ordinary taxpayers. The reality is that they vote for
> bigger government and more spending right along with the Democrats. Now
> that Republicans control the presidency and both houses of Congress,
> spending is going up even faster than when Clinton was in charge. Of
> course government spending more money sooner or later means government
> taking more money out of your pocket.
>
> Democrats likewise talk a good game about being for civil liberties
> and civil rights. The reality is they go right along with Republicans
> in pouring billions of dollars into the war on drugs, imposing stiffer
> and stiffer criminal penalties, and passing unconstitutional laws that
> trash the Bill of Rights and ramp up the police state. It was a
> Democratic Senator who sponsored the anti-rave "Reducing America's
> Vulnerability to Ecstasy" legislation.
>
> Bush has killed innocent civilians by bombing other countries. So did
> Clinton, usually supported by Democrats in Congress. He bombed Sudan
> and Bosnia, and sent troops to Bosnia, Kosovo, and Somalia. Democratic
> presidents got the United States into both World Wars, the Korean War,
> and the Vietnam War. Both Republican and Democrat leaders use military
> power as a tool not to champion freedom and democracy around the world
> where people are oppressed, but in order to advance U.S. interests or
> maintain the global status quo on behalf of their buddies who run the
> other governments of the world. Both parties have supported an
> expanding military budget and maintaining a large nuclear arsenal even
> after the Soviet Union collapsed from the weight of its own bloated and
> super-powerful government.
>
> Both Republicans and Democrats favor continuing the "winner take all"
> voting system and restrictive ballot access and campaign laws that
> place alternative parties like the Libertarians and Greens at a
> disadvantage. Each establishment party seeks to keep its supporters
> afraid the other party is going to do something horrible to them, thus
> they keep Americans voting for one or the other half of the two-party
> duopoly. In reality, Democrat and Republican leaders share the same
> primary concern: Maintaining their ability to control us and spend our
> money.
>

> >8. Race. Moore does not directly state that Heston is
> >a racist--he is the master of creating the false
> >impression --but reviewers come away saying "Heston
> >looks like an idiot, and a racist one at that" Source.
> >"BTW, one thing the Heston interview did clear up,
> >that man is shockingly racist." Source.
> >
> >     The remarks stem from Heston's answer (after Moore
> >keeps pressing for why the US has more violence than
> >other countries) that it might be due to the US
> >"having a more mixed ethnicity" than other nations,
> >and "We had enough problems with civil rights in the
> >beginning." A viewer who accepts Moore's theme that
> >gun ownership is driven by racial fears might conclude
> >that Heston is blaming blacks and the civil rights
> >movement.
> >
> >     But if you look at some history missing from
> >Bowling, you get exactly the opposite picture. Heston
> >is talking, not about race, but about racism. In the
> >early 1960s, the civil rights movement was fighting
> >for acceptance. Civil rights workers were being
> >murdered. The Kennedy Administration, trying to hold
> >together a Democratic coalition that ranged from
> >liberals to fire-eater segregationists such as George
> >Wallace and Lester Maddox, found the issue too hot to
> >touch, and offered little support.
> >
> >     Heston got involved. He picketed discriminating
> >restaurants. He worked with Martin Luther King, and
> >helped King break Hollywood's color barrier (yes,
> >there was one.). He led the actors' component of
> >King's 1963 march in Washington, which set the stage
> >for the key civil rights legislation in 1964.
> >
> >     Here's Heston's comments at the 2001 Congress on
> >Racial Equality Martin Luther King dinner (presided
> >over by NRA director, and CORE President, Roy Innes).
> >More on Heston.
> >
> >     Most of the viewers were born long after the
> >events Heston is recalling. To them, the civil rights
> >struggle consists of Martin Luther King speaking,
> >people singing "We Shall Overcome," and everyone
> >coming to their senses. Heston remembers what it was
> >really like.
> >
> >     If Heston fails to explain this in Bowling, we've
> >got to note that Moore (despite his claim that he left
> >the interview almost unedited) cut a lot of the
> >interview out. Watch closely and you'll see a clock on
> >the wall near Moore's head. When it's first seen, the
> >time is about 5:47. When Heston finally walks out, it
> >reads about 6:10. That's 23 minutes. I clocked the
> >Heston interview in Bowling at 5 1/4 minutes. About
> >three-quarters of what Heston did say was trimmed out.
> >[Why the clock indicates six o'clock, when Moore is
> >specific that he showed up for the interview at 8:30
> >AM, will have to await another investigation!]
> >

Subject: [sfraves] **House my Body, House MY BODY!!**

--0-1042456417-1071337174=:96574
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

This week on Daytrippin' we join our resident DJ's Buckner and Sean Davis as we welcome Nelson Perez and Christoph AKA The Shutterflooders, of Focused Music, Soul Phusion and Moonshine Recordings. So tune in and Get Down this Saturday to the funky-techy deep house goodliness you know and love. Tune your browser to www.pulseradio.net This and Every Saturday for the very best underground dance music. From 1-4pm EST
 
Pulseradio.net is a global internet radio station featuring 3 hour shows from all over the world! Started in Australia, the pulse crew has grown to represent shows from the U.K., the Far East, All parts of the US including shows from San Fran, New York, Orlando and Miami, South Africa, Boston, and Toronto, Canada.
 
While this email originates with the DJ's of Daytrippin which airs every Saturday from 1-4pm EST, we wish to highlight other shows as well. Here is a small list of the shows broadcast each Saturday as well as their corresponding genre of dance music. For a complete list, visit www.pulseradio.net and view the 'full schedule' for the whole week!
 
ALL TIMES EASTERN STANDARD TIME
5-8am The FatPharm playing Breaks and Bootlegs (AU-Sydney)
10am-1pm Rhythmic Jungle Punch playing Jungle/Drum 'n' Bass (US-Orlando)
1pm-4pm Daytrippin playing House, leaning toward tech and funk (US-Orlando)
4pm-7pm Gettin Smitten playing House, D 'n' B, Downtempo (US-Orlando)
7pm-10pm Euphoric Excursions playing Trance, Prog House and Breaks (US-Orlando)
10pm-1am Energy Guide playing Breaks (US-Orlando)
**Also be sure to check out Evolve from Boston on Mondays 7pm-9pm EST 4pm-6pm PST**

Good shit... oh, it wasn't a dork.. it was Tyler!!! It was a fun set!! Loved it Tyler! =)

OK... so ok... CJ's set (CAlaminty Jane) was sooooo fuckin' Awesome... good shit man... she spun a wonderful Awesome set of BAd Ass Breakbeats, I think I might a heard some hard house tunes in there.. but oooooooooh man... her breakbeats were heaven!!! I mean... seriously.. CJ know's what tracks go good 2gether in her soup of records she was pinning & I mean... every fcukin' time I see her spin.. I'm on a fuckni' HIGH after that... but man... I think i mighta heard some new vinyl?? Awesome!!! But yeah... i must also add that her "behind- the-decks-while-she-spinning" dancing has actually now evolved some... she doing more foward body bobswhile she spins & ooh man... when she twirls her hair when she's all you go girlfriend knob tweakin kinda 'tude... it's actually pretty sexy!! LoL Really! =) OK... I"m buggin'! 

OK.. Michael Anthony came on next after her... & it was Awesome... I mean.. he was spinning this like tribal house set then i dunno... it got like into kinda prog house i think... but ok.. he asked me what I wanted 2 hear... I said BREAKBEATS... & OK.. Hello 2day... he busted out this Awesome BReakbeats Track.. ok.. OK... than after him... Blooshaman spun... mmmmmmm.. more Acid Breakbeats... I Loved it... then he went in2 some tracne.. OK... later in heis set.. I could sworn he bumped something that was like a hybrib of Electroclash & trance or soemthing... LoL... it was Awesome!! I mean.. I always have fun when Blooshaman spins...

OK.. the Crowd was Groovy... LoL.. I was so happy 'cause well as it turned out... JC was there & WOW.. we had soooooooooo much 2 talk about... Hello 2day... things ranging from like well... 800 miles away & stuff... Philip Diaz was there

Oh oh oh oh... ok.. so like I met Hiedi from here... What Up Girl =) She is sooooo Awesome!!! I had the best time hangin' out w/ her & man...we can like talk & talk & talk & talk & talk & talk as we did 4 like almost an hour lastnight about eeeeeeeeeeverything!!! LoL

JBlaze came by & we kicked it... it was Dope... he brought this Awesome girl..I 4got her name.. but she was fun... LoL... we were all like dancing 2 Blooshamans set downstairs & she was all like well.. she almost dances like Molly Ringwald in breakfast club...

Oh gosh.. who else was there... ooh oh oh .. so like after Sublounge closed... JBlaze, Girl, & I were outside chilin'... then we well.. they were talkn' 2 someone else... but i was talkin' 2 these Irish Dudes who live in the mission & we like lol.. well.. they were hella funny 2 hang out... LoL... oh yeah.. there's a new dance I learned called the 1,2,3 stop & pose dance... anyway... it's god 2 like do htat during house music... anywaze,, it was a fun night

So JBlaze said he'd bring me home so like afterwards.. we had soup & icecream @ her placein the mission.. it was fun...

Oh Gosh man..I had suck a fun time lastnight!!! =)

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the President or
that we are to stand by the President right or wrong is not only
unpatriotic and servile but it is morally treasonable to the
American public."

-Theodore Roosevelt, 1918

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

At 06:58 PM 12/13/2003, J.C. wrote:
>On 31 December 2003, micromu wrote:
>
> > Read the first site and quit listening to this slob Moore.  Evidence is
> > evidence, so read it.
> >
> > "Well of course it was staged! It's a movie! We built the "bank" as a set
> > and then I hired actors to play the bank tellers and the manager and we got
> > a toy gun from the prop department and then I wrote some really cool
> > dialogue for me and them to say! Pretty neat, huh?"
>
>Oh, kinda like landing on an aircraft carrier???  Or holding a tray with
>a turkey during Thanksgiving??

Ah yes, the aircraft carrier that was in sight of land, so a helicopter 
would have done.  Then the turkey dinner.  Even Stars and Stripes had 
issues with that performance:

washingtonpost.com

A Baghdad Thanksgiving's Lingering Aftertaste

By Dana Milbank

Friday, December 12, 2003; Page A35

Stars and Stripes, the Pentagon-authorized newspaper of the U.S. military, 
is bucking for a court-martial.

When last we checked in on Stripes, it was reporting on a survey it did of 
troops in Iraq, finding that half of those questioned described their 
units' moral as low and their training as insufficient and said they did 
not plan to reenlist.

With the Pentagon just recovering from that, Stars and Stripes is blowing 
the whistle on President Bush's Thanksgiving visit to Baghdad, saying the 
cheering soldiers who met him were pre-screened and others showing up for a 
turkey dinner were turned away.

The newspaper, quoting two officials with the Army's 1st Armored Division 
in an article last week, reported that "for security reasons, only those 
preselected got into the facility during Bush's visit. . . . The soldiers 
who dined while the president visited were selected by their chain of 
command, and were notified a short time before the visit."

The paper also published a letter to the editor from Sgt. Loren Russell, 
who wrote of the heroism of his soldiers and then added: "[I]magine their 
dismay when they walked 15 minutes to the Bob Hope Dining Facility, only to 
find that they were turned away from their evening meal because they were 
in the wrong unit. . . . They understand that President Bush ate there and 
that upgraded security was required. But why were only certain units turned 
away?"

Russell added that his soldiers "chose to complain amongst themselves and 
eat MREs, even after the chow hall was reopened for 'usual business' at 9 
p.m. As a leader myself, I'd guess that other measures could have been 
taken to allow for proper security and still let the soldiers have their meal."

The 1st Armored Division officials told Stars and Stripes that all soldiers 
had the opportunity to get a proper Thanksgiving meal -- possibly more than 
the newspaper's editors will get in Guantanamo next year.






Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

-- 
"To announce that there must be no criticism of the President or
that we are to stand by the President right or wrong is not only
unpatriotic and servile but it is morally treasonable to the
American public."

-Theodore Roosevelt, 1918

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Subject: [sfraves] .: 2night | Dirtbox Radio | Relapse | Lycan | BLOOD EVERYWHERE! :.


Good afternoon, and welcome to your weekly Dirtbox Radio Promotional
Email.  We here at Dirtbox Radio strive to present to you the finest in
promotional emails, and hope that you enjoy reading them as much as we
enjoy writing them.

Dirtbox Radio begins broadcasting at 7pm Eastern Standard Time tonight, as
we have been doing for nearly .  Keeping with the tradition of bringing
you talented guest DJs from around the DC Metro area, we are proud to
present you with the following guest DJs:

9:30-11pm EST _Relapse_

When Relapse first came out to play on the show over a year ago, it was
obvious that he has a deep-seated love for drum 'n' bass, and the talent
to make it audible.  Focusing on the darker, tech-heavy side of drum 'n'
bass, his mixes are quite precise, energetic, and feature a wide variety
of artists.  As of late, Relapse has been holed up in his studio working
on tunes, so hopefully we'll twist his arm into playing an original or two
for us tonight.

08-9:30pm EST _Lycan_

Lycan initially caught our interest spinning breaks as Kenobi, when he
rolled out here with the Dartainian crew.  His energy and enthusiasm is
contagious, so when he mentioned that he spun drum 'n' bass as well, we
had to get him back out here.  Like so many others around the DC Metro
area, Lycan proves that talent is not just the domain of world famous DJs.

?? _Davey A_

We might just get the one like Davey A on the show tonight, as he's back
in town from West Virginia at the moment.  Dave's a good friend of the
Dirtbox Kru, a damn nice guy, and a solid DJ.  We're always glad to have
him on the show, to be blessed by his mixing and selection prowess.

To join the show tonight, just follow the links below:

Links Page: http://dirtboxradio.com/listen.html

128k audio: http://64.246.60.15:8800/listen.pls
64k audio: http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k audio: http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls

webcam: http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

Jungletrain chat:
http://jungletrain.net/index.php?page=2&subpage=0&color=2
Destroyer chat: http://destroyer.net/chat
AIM: dirtboxradio

That should be just about all of the pertinent information regarding
tonight's broadcast extravaganza.  We hope that all of you will tune, in,
brock out, and talk shit to us in the chat room.

Easy,
Jackson (ODJ)
Partners in Crime _ Dirtbox Radio _ Trividual Productions _ ALIAS _ Panty
Raid Brigade

.....................jackson.
.partners.in.crime...........
.dirtbox.radio...............
.trividual.productions.......
.a.l.i.a.s...................
.........................odj.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: Republicans and Democrats -- how different are they, really?

It's pretty clear in that segment of his rant that the scene wasn't
staged.  He says, "Yeah, we staged it, neat, huh?", and then says:

"When you see me going in to the bank and walking out with my new gun
in "Bowling for Columbine" – that is exactly as it happened. Nothing
was done out of the ordinary other than to phone ahead and ask
permission to let me bring a camera in to film me opening up my
account. I walked into that bank in northern Michigan for the first
time ever on that day in June 2001, and, with cameras rolling, gave the
bank teller $1,000 – and opened up a 20-year CD account."

Looks like sarcasm, to me.

To me, even if the movie had been a ruse in toto, it shed light on a
desperately underexposed subject and stirred thought throughout the
nation.  The "other side" lies, cheats, and steals its way into power
and credibility, and I'll be damned if I'd condemn Michael Moore for
using those same tactics in opposition.

As it stands, if what he says about "not one lawsuit has been filed" is
true, then it stands to reason that he was in the right.  A large,
well-funded organization like the NRA would have sued the living sh*t
out of him if they thought they had a leg to stand on concerning libel
or slander- let alone good 'ol Heston!


George

Subject: [sfraves] COMPRESSION WAS SO DAMN AWESOME LASTNIGHT

OK... so like still feeling hella bad 4 missing out goin' 2 Sticky 'cause my poor ass is still broke & I kinda had the company of non ravers I was entertaining Sat night who had 2 get a few hours of sleep b4 they treked 2 some place like Mid Cali 2 visit some1 in prison... I couldn't make it ( I wanna see reviews SFRAVERS! =) 

So Jblaze ( he's now renamed Jaze 4 legal reasons & that name sounds Cooler =) & we made plans 2 go 2 Compression on Saturday night when i got home 4 Sunday & Sunday night came & it was on!! There was a DJ spinning frm LA who I caught when i was down there earlier this year that I couldn't miss him & his MC (NIGHTSTALKER (knowledge, 45psi, LA) with MC XYZ (45psi, LA)) & well... I was on GL anyway 'cause The Sleeveless Chicas hooked me up, but like Jaze & I went early 'cause well... the Sleeveless Girls opened up the night doin this Awesome Tag Set.. I Loved it... I meann... their set was pretty not mellow, but not hard.. there was alota like recent years tracks released that that played, some old skool, but man... I Loved it!!

OK... then close 2 midnight, NightStalker & MC XYZ came on & ooooooooh my goodness.. Hello 2Day... strait away... this Dark evil HARD jungle track starts bumping outta the speakers & I was in Hevean!!  Infact... the whole set was pretty dark & hard... i mean... it was so hard not 2 dance during this set.. it was so hard not 2 dance during this whole night so far 'cause even Sleeveless played tracks that made me get ouuta my seat like mondo times....

BUt yeah... Nightstalkers set was sick... I mean... he even played  few hardcore tracks during his set actually... the 1st hardcore track he spun  was Dope 'cause well... it went from Hardcore 2 breakcore 2 Jungle like all w/in like the 1st 3-5 mintues... (hmmmmm... a SwitchCraft track maybe?)... then the other Hardcore track he spun he jus' totally stopped spinning or like there was this long ass breakdown during 1 of his tracks... the he said...

"Who wants me to bump some hardcore?"

Ofcourse I was yeling my ass off 'cause Hello 2Day...

then he played this strait up evil hardcore track & me & Jaze were dancing so hard.. LoL... the break dancers didn't what the fuck was goin' on 'cuse there were 2 of them like batling the whole night 2 the Jungle... LoL.. so they jus' stood there... but they were dope!!

@ the end of his set... I totally had 2 talk 2 him & tell him what an Awesome fuckin' Job he did spinning!!  I mean... I Love seeing DJs when they get off behind the decks when they spin & this guy is like a cartoon character toy thing responsive to bass & percussion 'cause he moved accordingly to all his tracks,,, Loved it man!  So Dope! =)  Oh Yeah... the 2nd Hardcore was produced by Omar Santana 'cause I asked him & we had a talk about that also!!  This DJ NightStalker Dude is Hella Dope man!

Then UFO went on & it was Sick... he played off his computer when he started off & it was Sick... he started out w/ some hip hop then started playing this well.. it was like marching band music 4 a few minutes... funny song.. then back 2 some hip hop i think... then strait in2 Jungle... Jaze & I didn't stay 4 his whole set & I didn't get 2 talk 2 UFO 2 much lastnight... but man.. what a Groovy time it was lastnight!!

The crowd was kinda small... I mean.. there were some people I knew... but aparently.. there was this bowling thing that was sponsered by XLR8R (sp) magazine in Daly City so I didn't get 2 hang out w/ the usual Jungle Fam... but I did C Sooz who i ain't seen since my Borthday... the ;last timeI went 2 compression... & met some new people.. It was toatlly a fun night thought... good shit man... Loved it!!! =)



Fun Stuff man =)



Take Care,

In a message dated 12/12/2003 7:36:52 AM Pacific Standard Time, DEB62 writes:
THREE MEN -- ONE GERMAN, ONE JAPANESE AND A HILLBILLY -- WERE SITTING NAKED 
IN A SAUNA. 

SUDDENLY THERE WAS A BEEPING SOUND. THE GERMAN PRESSED HIS FOREARM AND THE 
BEEP STOPPED. THE OTHERS LOOKED AT HIM QUESTIONINGLY.

"THAT WAS MY PAGER," HE SAID. " I HAVE A MICROCHIP UNDER THE SKIN OF MY ARM." 

A FEW MINUTES LATER, A PHONE RANG. THE JAPANESE FELLOW LIFTED HIS PALM TO HIS 
EAR. 

WHEN HE FINISHED, HE EXPLAINED, "THAT WAS MY MOBILE PHONE. I HAVE A MICROCHIP 
IN MY HAND." 

THE HILLBILLY FELT DECIDEDLY LOW TECH. NOT TO BE OUTDONE, HE DECIDED HE HAD 
TO DO SOMETHING JUST AS IMPRESSIVE. 

HE STEPPED OUT OF THE SAUNA AND WENT TO THE BATHROOM. HE RETURNED WITH A 
PIECE OF TOILET PAPER HANGING FROM HIS BEHIND. 

THE OTHERS RAISED THEIR EYEBROWS AND STARED AT HIM. 

THE HILLBILLY FINALLY SAID, "WELL, WILL YOU LOOK AT THAT. I'M GETTING A FAX."

-------------------------------1071538066

Subject: Subject: German, Japanese and Hillbilly   
To: Allen.Troxell@GTECH.COM, BarbaraM@RECOMHQ.com,

MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Mailer: 9.0 for Windows sub 5101


-------------------------------1071243412
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

THREE MEN -- ONE GERMAN, ONE JAPANESE AND A HILLBILLY -- WERE SITTING NAKED 
IN A SAUNA. 

SUDDENLY THERE WAS A BEEPING SOUND. THE GERMAN PRESSED HIS FOREARM AND THE 
BEEP STOPPED. THE OTHERS LOOKED AT HIM QUESTIONINGLY.

"THAT WAS MY PAGER," HE SAID. " I HAVE A MICROCHIP UNDER THE SKIN OF MY ARM." 

A FEW MINUTES LATER, A PHONE RANG. THE JAPANESE FELLOW LIFTED HIS PALM TO HIS 
EAR. 

WHEN HE FINISHED, HE EXPLAINED, "THAT WAS MY MOBILE PHONE. I HAVE A MICROCHIP 
IN MY HAND." 

THE HILLBILLY FELT DECIDEDLY LOW TECH. NOT TO BE OUTDONE, HE DECIDED HE HAD 
TO DO SOMETHING JUST AS IMPRESSIVE. 

HE STEPPED OUT OF THE SAUNA AND WENT TO THE BATHROOM. HE RETURNED WITH A 
PIECE OF TOILET PAPER HANGING FROM HIS BEHIND. 

THE OTHERS RAISED THEIR EYEBROWS AND STARED AT HIM. 

THE HILLBILLY FINALLY SAID, "WELL, WILL YOU LOOK AT THAT. I'M GETTING A FAX."

-------------------------------1071243412
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Date: Mon, 15 Dec 2003 21:06:25 -0800 (PST)
From: Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com>
To: micromu <micromu@sbcglobal.net>
cc:  <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <001501c3c37f$a2d903a0$0500a8c0@isme>
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.33.0312152105020.5368-100000@charm>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR Republicans and Democrats -- how different are
 they, really?

Here's the whole quote from
http://www.michaelmoore.com/words/wackoattacko/ :


--
So, how crazy are the things they've said about "Bowling for Columbine?"
Here are my favorites:

    "That scene where you got the gun in the bank was staged!"

Well of course it was staged! It's a movie! We built the "bank" as a set
and then I hired actors to play the bank tellers and the manager and we
got a toy gun from the prop department and then I wrote some really cool
dialogue for me and them to say! Pretty neat, huh?

Or...

The Truth: In the spring of 2001, I saw a real ad in a real newspaper in
Michigan announcing a real promotion that this real bank had where they
would give you a gun (as your up-front interest) for opening up a
Certificate of Deposit account. They promoted this in publications all
over the country . "More Bang for Your Buck!"

There was news coverage of this bank giving away guns, long before I even
shot the scene there. The Chicago Sun Times wrote about how the bank would
"hand you a gun" with the purchase of a CD. Those are the precise words
used by a bank employee in the film.

When you see me going in to the bank and walking out with my new gun in
"Bowling for Columbine" . that is exactly as it happened. Nothing was done
out of the ordinary other than to phone ahead and ask permission to let me
bring a camera in to film me opening up my account. I walked into that
bank in northern Michigan for the first time ever on that day in June
2001, and, with cameras rolling, gave the bank teller $1,000 . and opened
up a 20-year CD account. After you see me filling out the required federal
forms ("How do you spell Caucasian?") . which I am filling out here for
the first time . the bank manager faxed it to the bank's main office for
them to do the background check. The bank is a licensed federal arms
dealer and thus can have guns on the premises and do the instant
background checks (the ATF's Federal Firearms database.which includes all
federally approved gun dealers.lists North Country Bank with Federal
Firearms License #4-38-153-01-5C-39922).

Within 10 minutes, the "OK" came through from the firearms background
check agency and, 5 minutes later, just as you see it in the film, they
handed me a Weatherby Mark V Magnum rifle (If you'd like to see the
outtakes, click here).

And it is that very gun that I still own to this day. I have decided the
best thing to do with this gun is to melt it down into a bust of John
Ashcroft and auction it off on E-Bay (more details on that later). All the
proceeds will go to The Brady Campaign To Prevent Gun Violence to fight
all these lying gun nuts who have attacked my film and make it possible on
a daily basis for America's gun epidemic to rage on.
--

> Here's the whole quote from
> http://www.michaelmoore.com/words/wackoattacko/ :
>
>
> --
> So, how crazy are the things they've said about "Bowling for Columbine?"
> Here are my favorites:
>
>     "That scene where you got the gun in the bank was staged!"
>
> Well of course it was staged! It's a movie! We built the "bank" as a set
> and then I hired actors to play the bank tellers and the manager and we
> got a toy gun from the prop department and then I wrote some really cool
> dialogue for me and them to say! Pretty neat, huh?
>
> Or...
>
> The Truth: In the spring of 2001, I saw a real ad in a real newspaper in
> Michigan announcing a real promotion that this real bank had where they
> would give you a gun (as your up-front interest) for opening up a
> Certificate of Deposit account. They promoted this in publications all
> over the country . "More Bang for Your Buck!"
>
> There was news coverage of this bank giving away guns, long before I even
> shot the scene there. The Chicago Sun Times wrote about how the bank would
> "hand you a gun" with the purchase of a CD. Those are the precise words
> used by a bank employee in the film.
>
> When you see me going in to the bank and walking out with my new gun in
> "Bowling for Columbine" . that is exactly as it happened. Nothing was done
> out of the ordinary other than to phone ahead and ask permission to let me
> bring a camera in to film me opening up my account. I walked into that
> bank in northern Michigan for the first time ever on that day in June
> 2001, and, with cameras rolling, gave the bank teller $1,000 . and opened
> up a 20-year CD account. After you see me filling out the required federal
> forms ("How do you spell Caucasian?") . which I am filling out here for
> the first time . the bank manager faxed it to the bank's main office for
> them to do the background check. The bank is a licensed federal arms
> dealer and thus can have guns on the premises and do the instant
> background checks (the ATF's Federal Firearms database.which includes all
> federally approved gun dealers.lists North Country Bank with Federal
> Firearms License #4-38-153-01-5C-39922).
>
> Within 10 minutes, the "OK" came through from the firearms background
> check agency and, 5 minutes later, just as you see it in the film, they
> handed me a Weatherby Mark V Magnum rifle (If you'd like to see the
> outtakes, click here).
>
> And it is that very gun that I still own to this day. I have decided the
> best thing to do with this gun is to melt it down into a bust of John
> Ashcroft and auction it off on E-Bay (more details on that later). All the
> proceeds will go to The Brady Campaign To Prevent Gun Violence to fight
> all these lying gun nuts who have attacked my film and make it possible on
> a daily basis for America's gun epidemic to rage on.
> --
>
>

Message-ID: <54632.63.103.66.56.1071606489.squirrel@webmail.kartre.net>
Date: Tue, 16 Dec 2003 12:28:09 -0800 (PST)
From: "Ringfinger" <carter@kartre.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Reply-To: carter@kartre.net
User-Agent: SquirrelMail/1.4.2
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Priority: 3
Importance: Normal
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Modern Vernacular for Office & Life

Totally NRR, but this is the funniest stuff I've seen in a while... The
first several may resonate more with corporate drones like myself...

BLAMESTORMING:
Sitting around in a group, discussing why a deadline was missed or a
project failed, and who was responsible.

SEAGULL MANAGER:
A manager who flies in, makes a lot of noise, craps on everything, and
then leaves.

ASSMOSIS:
The process by which some people seem to absorb success and advancement by
kissing up to the boss rather than working hard.

SALMON DAY:
The experience of spending an entire day swimming upstream only to get
screwed and die in the end.

CUBE FARM:
An office filled with cubicles.

PRAIRIE DOGGING:
When someone yells or drops something loudly in a cube farm, and people's
heads pop up over the walls to see what's going on.

MOUSE POTATO:
The on-line, wired generation's answer to the couch potato.

SITCOMS:
Single Income, Two Children, Oppressive Mortgage.What yuppies turn into
when they have children and one of them stops working to stay home with
the kids.

STRESS PUPPY:
A person who seems to thrive on being stressed out and whiney.

SWIPEOUT:
An ATM or credit card that has been rendered useless because the magnetic
strip is worn away from extensive use.

XEROX SUBSIDY:
Euphemism for swiping free photocopies from one's workplace.

IRRITAINMENT:
Entertainment and media spectacles that are annoying but you find yourself
unable to stop watching them. The O.J. trials were a prime example.

PERCUSSIVE MAINTENANCE:
The fine art of whacking the crap out of an electronic device to get it to
work again.

ADMINISPHERE:
The rarefied organizational layers beginning just above the rank and file.
Decisions that fall from the adminisphere are often profoundly
inappropriate or irrelevant to the problems they were designed to solve.

404:
Someone who's clueless. (From the World Wide Web errormessage "404 Not
Found," meaning that the requested document could not be located.)

GENERICA:
Features of the American landscape that are exactly the same no matter
where one is, such as fast food joints, strip malls, subdivisions.

OHNOSECOND:
That minuscule fraction of time in which you realize that you've just made
a BIG mistake.

WOOFYS:
Well Off Older Folks.

CROP DUSTING:
Surreptitiously passing wind while walking thru a cube farm, then enjoying
the sounds of dismay and disgust; leads to PRAIRIEDOGG


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Subject: [sfraves] very NRR: Saddam Hussein and "his own people" (not)

hi, just a quick rant about how many people in the media refer to Saddam Hussein using chemical weapons against "his own people." He used them on Kurds, who are not his people. His people are Sunni Muslims and are from the central part of Iraq, whereas the Kurds are in the north (and minority Shiite Muslims are in the central part and the south as well). 

It's as if, say, we had a white supremacist President, and he undertook policies that were outrageously hostile to African-Americans, Asian-Americans, Mexican immigrants, etc. They would not be considered "his people" because he would see them as adversaries. If a homophobic President enacted anti-gay policies, they would not be directed at "his own people" but at his enemies. 

However, it does appear that Saddam Hussein had members of his extended family executed -- sons in law. Those could be considered "his people." And, perhaps he DID use chemical weapons against some Sunni Muslims (his people). 
He claims that it was Iran that used chemical weapons against the Kurds. This is not impossible as Iran borders on the Kurdish part of Iraq. 
Of course, it was the US that armed Saddam Hussein in the 1980s so Iraq could fight Iran, but that's a whole different subject. It was to Israel's benefit that Iraq and Iran were at war, so neither country could go after Israel. 
Who's next in this real game of Risk? Syria? Iran? And thanks to the current regime, soon we'll have the proliferation of "small" nuclear weapons to worry about. 
It's interesting to see how many anti-Bush books are in the NY Times bestseller list. Many people will find Michael Moore, Al Franken, Molly Ivins, and Noam Chomsky books under the Christmas tree this year. 
Dude, where IS my country?

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

At 02:19 PM 12/14/2003, Andrew Phelan wrote:
>I second that motion!  Sticky was an absolute blast, thanks to John and the
>whole crew for putting it together.  I really enjoyed the vibe the whole
>night, lots of friends, happy faces, and a great little venue.  Thanks for
>the good time!
>
>-Andrew

And thank you, Andrew and your partner on the keys RFM, for another great 
set!!!!

Yes, Sticky was a tight little underground with a great vibe.  So many 
friends I barely had time to dance.  It was a very pleasant surprise to see 
Becca again after so many months.

One of the memorable moments of the night.  We went upstairs to the 
"naughty" chill room to take in Andy W's ambient set.  Quite a departure 
from what I usually hear him spin, with some good hip hop in the mix.  In 
the middle of his performance someone knocked over a large floor to ceiling 
mirror and the thing broke all over the dance floor near the 
decks.  Shortly after this a fuse blew and Andy's equipment went out.  Then 
a woman engaged us in an animated conversation about 7 years' bad luck for 
the poor guy who smashed the thing.  Ha...who knows.  At that point we went 
downstairs to take in the rest of Adnan's set.

Unfortunately about three or so the neighbors complained about the sound, 
so some of us stood about outside in the garden and talked then agreed to 
go to someone's home for an afterparty with Andan providing the entertainment.

All in all, a good party and happy evening.  Thanks John and the rest of 
the Sticky crew!!!

Much love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

> hi, just a quick rant about how many people in the media refer to Saddam
Hussein using chemical weapons against "his own people." He used them on
Kurds, who are not his people. His people are Sunni Muslims and are from the
central part of Iraq, whereas the Kurds are in the north (and minority
Shiite Muslims are in the central part and the south as well).

Actually the Shite are the majority.  Now ya know.  ANd when the media use a
term like "his own people" let's not get semantic and not understand that is
what is meant is "the Iraqi people", of which Kurds indeed are.

> It's as if, say, we had a white supremacist President, and he undertook
policies that were outrageously hostile to African-Americans,
Asian-Americans, Mexican immigrants, etc. They would not be considered "his
people" because he would see them as adversaries. If a homophobic President
enacted anti-gay policies, they would not be directed at "his own people"
but at his enemies.
>
> However, it does appear that Saddam Hussein had members of his extended
family executed -- sons in law. Those could be considered "his people." And,
perhaps he DID use chemical weapons against some Sunni Muslims (his people).

He did execute members of his family, tens of thousands of Shite, don't know
how many Sunni, and did use (not perhaps did use) chemical weapons to kill
about 470,000 Kurds.  These facts stand alone, regardless of our actions now
in Iraq, why we went, and the rest.

> He claims that it was Iran that used chemical weapons against the Kurds.
This is not impossible as Iran borders on the Kurdish part of Iraq.
> Of course, it was the US that armed Saddam Hussein in the 1980s so Iraq
could fight Iran, but that's a whole different subject. It was to Israel's
benefit that Iraq and Iran were at war, so neither country could go after
Israel.

The Kurds would disagree with you, and if Chemical Ali (God rest his sole)
could speak, i'm sure he'd correct you're attempt to place the blame
elsewhere.  Please don't forget that it was Iraq that invaded Iran.  Iran
doesn't give a rats about Israel, so let's not jump to any unnecessary
conclusions.  Again, Iraq invaded Iran, and the Iranians are Persians first
and could give a toss about Jews.
http://www.fas.org/man/dod-101/ops/war/iran-iraq.htm

> Who's next in this real game of Risk? Syria? Iran? And thanks to the
current regime, soon we'll have the proliferation of "small" nuclear weapons
to worry about.
> It's interesting to see how many anti-Bush books are in the NY Times
bestseller list. Many people will find Michael Moore, Al Franken, Molly
Ivins, and Noam Chomsky books under the Christmas tree this year.
> Dude, where IS my country?

damned Jews!   Of course all the loose nuclear material and missle

> And thank you, Andrew and your partner on the keys RFM, for
> another great
> set!!!!
>
> Yes, Sticky was a tight little underground with a great vibe.
>  So many
> friends I barely had time to dance.  It was a very pleasant
> surprise to see
> Becca again after so many months.
>
> One of the memorable moments of the night.  We went upstairs
> to the
> "naughty" chill room to take in Andy W's ambient set.  Quite
> a departure
> from what I usually hear him spin, with some good hip hop in
> the mix.  In
> the middle of his performance someone knocked over a large
> floor to ceiling
> mirror and the thing broke all over the dance floor near the
> decks.  Shortly after this a fuse blew and Andy's equipment
> went out.  Then
> a woman engaged us in an animated conversation about 7 years'
> bad luck for
> the poor guy who smashed the thing.  Ha...who knows.  At that
> point we went
> downstairs to take in the rest of Adnan's set.
>
> Unfortunately about three or so the neighbors complained
> about the sound,
> so some of us stood about outside in the garden and talked
> then agreed to
> go to someone's home for an afterparty with Andan providing
> the entertainment.
>
> All in all, a good party and happy evening.  Thanks John and
> the rest of
> the Sticky crew!!!
>
> Much love,
>
> Apollo

maybe one of you dj's or music person on this list will use some of these 
names or spellings for songs or even your own handles :-) what ever you do let me 
know it will be cool. thanks.
Female Egyptian Names 
  
AIN:  priceless 
AKILA:  intelligent
AMUNET:  myth name (goddess of mystery)
ANAT:  myth name (a wife of Seth)
ANIPPE:  daughter of the Nile
ASTARTE:  myth name (a wife of Seth)
AUSET:  myth name (another name for Isis)
AZIZA:  precious
BAHITI:  fortune
BAST:  myth name (personification of the heat of the sun)
BASTET:  myth name (cat)
BENNU:  eagle
CHIONE:  myth name (daughter of the Nile)
CLEOPATRA:  name of a queen
DENDERA:  from Dendera
DALILA:  gentle
ECHIDNA:  myth name (a monster)
EDJO:  myth name (another form of Uadjit)
ESHE:  life
FEMI:  love
FUKAYNA:  intelligent
HABIBAH:  loved
HAFSAH:  married to the prophet
HALIMA:  gentle
HAQIKAH:  honest
HASINA:  good
HATHOR, HATHOR-SAKMET:  myth name (goddess of destruction)
HATSHEPSUT:  name of a queen
HEHET:  myth name (goddess of the immeasurable)
HEQET:  myth name (a frog-headed goddess)
IFE:  love
ISIS:  myth name (goddess of magic)
JAMILA:  beauty
JENDAYI:  thankful
KAKRA:  a twin
KAMILAH:  perfection
KANIKA:  black
KEKET:  myth name (goddess of darkness)
KESI:  born of a troubled father
KHEPRI:  morning sun
KISSA:  sister of twins
LAPIS:  named for the lapis stone
LAYLA:  born at night
LOTUS:  lotus flower
MAAT:  myth name (goddess of order and justice)
MAFUANE:  soil
MAIBE:  grave
MANDISA:  sweet
MASIKA:  born during rain
MEHT-URT:  represented by a cow
MEMPHIS:  myth name
MERT, MERT-SEKERT:  lover of silence
MESI:  water
MESKHENET:  destiny
MONIFA:  lucky
MOSI:  born first
MOSWEN:  white
MUKAMUTARA:  daughter of Mutara

MUMINAH:  pious
MUT:  myth name (mother)
NAUNET:  myth name (goddess of the ocean)

NATHIFA:  pure
NEEMA:  born to wealthy parents
NEFERTITI:  name of a queen

NET, NEITH:  the divine mother
NILE:  from the Nile
NIT:  myth name
NIUT:  myth name (goddess of nothingness)
NOURBESE:  wonderful

NURU:  born during the day

ODE:  from the road
OLABISI:  brings joy

TALE:  green
TALIBAH:  seeks knowledge
TAURET:  myth name (goddess of pregnant women)
TEFNUT:  myth name (atmospheric moisture)
THEMA:  queen
THEORIS:  great
THERMUTHIS:  myth name (another form of Renenet)
UADJIT:  myth name (cobra-goddess)
UATCHIT:  myth name (another form of Hathor)
UMAYMA:  little mother
UMM:  mother
URBI:  princess
WALIDAH:  newly born
YAMINAH:  meaning unknown
ZAHRA:  flower
ZALIKA, ZALIKI:  well-born
ZESIRO:  a twin



The meaning of most Japanese first and last names can be found using the list 
of common components below.  Example surnames: 
Matsushita:  below the pine
Suzuki:  bell tree
Yamamoto:  base of the mountain
Common Components of Japanese names:
aka:  red
aki:  autumn
-bashi (suffix):  bridge
-da (suffix):  rice paddy
fuji:  wisteria
fuku:  good fortune; wealthy
furu:  old
-gawa (suffix):  river
-guchi (suffix):  mouth
hana:  flower
hara:  field; plain
hashi:  bridge
hira:  flat; smooth
hon:  base; main
hoshi:  star
ichi:  one
iwa:  rock
kami:  god; upper; top
kawa:  river
ki:  tree
kita:  north
-ko (suffix):  child
kuchi:  mouth
kuro:  black
marui:  round
matsu:  pine
miya:  Shinto shrine
mori:  forest
moto:  base; originmura:  village
nabe:  pan; pot
naka:  middle
nishi:  west
-no (suffix):  field; plain
o (long):  large; great
o (short):  little
oka:  hill
-ro (suffix):  for numbering sons
saka:  slope
saki:  headland; cape
sawa:  marsh; swamp
shima:  island
shita:  lower; below; base
suzu:  bell
ta:  rice paddy
taka:  high
take:  bamboo
-to (suffix):  wisteria
toku:  virtuous
toyo:  plentiful; abundant
ue:  upper; top
wa:  peace; harmony
-wara (suffix):  field; plain
yama:  mountain
yoshi:  good luck; joy
-zawa (suffix):  marsh; swamp
zen:  good; virtue
*NAMES*


AIKO:  little love; beloved 
AKI:  born in Autumn
AKIKO:  autumn child; iris
AKINA:  spring flower
ANDA:  meet at the field; also a Japanese surname.
ANEKO:  older sister
AYAME:  iris
CHIKA:  near
CHIKO:  a unisexual name meaning "arrow; pledge."
CHIYO:  thousand years; eternal
CHO:  butterfy
DAI:  great
ERIKO:  child with a collar
GIN:  silvery
HANA:  flower; blossom
HARU:  born in the spring
HARUKO:  spring child
HISA:  long-lasting
HOSHI:  star
HOSHIKO:  star child
JUN'KO:  meaning unknown
KAEDE:  maple leaf
KAMEKO:  child of the tortoise; symbol for long life
KAMI, KAMLYN, KAMMI, KAMMIE:  Lord
KAYA:  adds a place of resting
KEI:  rapture; reverence
KEIKO:  adored one
KIMI:  she who is without equal
KIOKO:  happy child; meets the world with happiness
KITA:  north
KOHANA:  little flower
KOTO:  harp
KUMI:  braid; drawing together
KUMIKO:  companion child
KUNI: meaning unknown
KURI:  chestnut
KYOKO:  mirror
LEIKO:  arrogant
MACHIKO:  fortunate child
MAEKO:  honest child
MAEMI:  smile of truth
MAI:  brightness
MAIYA:  surname meaning "rice valley
MARIKO:  ball; circle
MARISE:  infinite; endless
MASAKO:  meaning unknown
MATSUKO:  pine tree child
MICHIE:  gateway; gracefully drooping flower
MICHIKO:  child of beauty; the righteous way
MIDORI:  green
MIKI:  flower stalk
MINA:  south
MITSU:  surname meaning "shine; reflect."
MIYA:  three arrows; temple; sacred house
NAMI:  wave
NARIKO:  gentle child
NATSUKO:  summer child
NIKKI:  Unisexual name meaning "two trees." Also a surname.
NORI, NORIKO:  doctrine; child of ceremony; law; order
NYOKO:  gem
OKI:  middle of the ocean
ORINO:  workman's meadow
RAN:  water lily
REI:  gratitude
SACHIKO, SACHI:  child of bliss
SAKURA:  cherry blossoms
SATU:  sugar
SHIKA:  deer
SHINA:  virtue; good
SHINO:  stem of bamboo
SUKI:  beloved
SUMI:  clear; refined
SUZU:  long-lived; crane
TAJI:  Surname meaning "silver and yellow color."
TAKA:  tall; honorable
TAKARA:  treasure; precious object
TAMAE:  ball; bell
TAMI:  let people see benefit
TAMIKA:  people
TANAK:  dweller
TAREE:  bending branch
TAURA:  many lakes; many rivers
TAYA:  valley field
TOSHI:  "mirror reflection" or "year of plenty"
TOYA:  Surname meaning "house door" or "door into the valley."
TSUYU, O-TSUYU:  Morning dew
YUMIKO:  arrow child
YONE, O-YONE: meaning unknown
YOSHIKO:  good child
YUKIKO:  snow child
YURIKO:  "Lily child" or "village of birth."

Subject: [sfraves] Thank You from STICKY!

We just want to say thanks to everyone who made it out to STICKY! on 
Saturday. What an incredible Christmas get down! Everyone who came brought 
their Christmas cheer and energy and the place was filledl with smiles and 
fun! From the decorations to the visuals to the sound in both rooms to the 
bar to the kitchen to the rainy fire garden, this place was decked and ready 
for action! Thanks to all the cast and crew, you guys rawked and put on a 
fantastic show!

If anyone has any pictures or reviews (especially from other lists I’m 
probably not on), could you please forward them to me? We’re making memory 
albums from each of the Sticky! parties.. Thanks.

Some of our personal highlights.. feel free to share yours…
Ryan covering himself in beer while fixing the jockey box.
Diane’s plastic cup Christmas light decorations.
The "fireplace" dj booth complete with hung stockings.
Watermelon jello-shots.
Putting out the fire pit in the garden because the storm winds were blowing 
hot coals toward the house.
Long Islands and Vodka Crans.
DJ2’s killer live set to a packed house.
Those potent blueberry and chocolate muffins.
Pop Pop’s secret eggnog recipe.
The easy-up blowing off the front entrance.
Boomerang Fidget’s intellectual rap session during his set.
Was that HOT cheese on the nachos? Who licked that bowl clean?
Muppet visuals.
Pucker shots.
The full size mirror that fell and broke into a million pieces right in 
front of the venue owner as we were negotiating why we needed to shut down 
and how late we could actually go.
Adnan rocking the joint something fierce.
And last but certainly not least, the 1001 compliments we got on the party 
during the course of the night.. Even when I had to shut Science down after 
only half a record, you were all extremely courteous and stayed until the 
wee hours to help clean up and finish the liquor! I didn’t feel any 
negativity at all the entire night from anyone.

Thank you and Merry Christmas. I know ours is already made.

See you in April,
The Sticky Family.

Subject: [sfraves] Gay Marriage poll, please take!!!

To all who are family, love family, or support equal rights for all human 
beings:

The American Family Association is doing a poll on gay marriage, which they 
are going to present the results of to Congress. Please pass this URL far 
and wide.

They give three options.  In favor, not in favor and in favor of civil union 
with all the privileges but not the name "marriage".  Let's make our Voice 
heard and initiate a positive change to the world in which our children will 
grow up!

http://www.afa.net/petitions/marriagepoll.asp

Only good can come of a unified effort, made in love!

Blessed Be.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: Sticky!


On Tue, 16 Dec 2003, SE/30 wrote:
-&e->about the mirror: yes, it took the nestea plunge, landing about a 2
-&e->feet from my left foot.  funny thing is that not a single person was
-&e->near it.  after it was cleaned up (which seemed about 30 seconds) i

Erm... someone had been sitting against it and got up (I know said person,
just can't recall as my memory is somewhat foggy of anything after like 15
minutes there).  That's when it fell.  In any case, just glad nobody got
hurt, lotta glass went boom.

-&e->went and looked at the wall and found that the 4 dinky screws that
-&e->were weakly screwed into the bare wallboard had vibrated clean off
-&e->(due to Andy's dropping a track off Face Value moments earlier no
-&e->doubt ;)

Dude, the world is finally ready to accept Phil Collins' cover version of
"Tomorrow Never Knows" and you're complaining about it.  Sheesh!

The history of that track is an amazing journey.

unknown date
Tibetan Book of the Dead (a poetic commentary on the nature of life,
death, and life after death) is written after Buddhism comes to Tibet.

1926
Tibetan Book of the Dead (Bardo Thodol) is translated to English.
Edited by Walter Y. Evans-Wentz and translated by Kazi Dawa Samdup

1964
Timothy Leary bases his "Psychedelic Experience" on this translation, and
tributes the book to Carl Jung, the translator and editor of the original,
and dedicates it to Aldous Huxley who really introduced Western pop
society to the trip in the Doors of Perception and passed away during the
writing of the Leary book.  As an aside, Richard Alpert (now Ram Dass), a
buddy of Leary's wrote "Be Here Now" which is supposed to be a prelude to
this book but really beats the shit out of it like 900 fold and stands
much better on it's own.  The writings of Leary, Huxley, and the Beats
(Kerouac, Ginsberg, Burroughs, etc) fuel a popular movement that changes
the very fabric of American culture and late 20th century art leading to a
massive leftward lean (including a redefinition of gender roles, societal
mores, understanding of drugs, anti corporate and government sentiments)
from upper and middle class youth and hipster society.  While not a
popularly accepted theory, many Eastern Europeans and citizens of the
former USSR credit the popular music of that time as the single most
appealling and pervasive instrument in swaying opinion of America (and by
inference the west in general) as a true land of freedom rather than
believing the propaganda of their countrymen (notable persons to have said
this include Vaclav Havel and my father who emigrated here in the late
60s).

1966
Beatles quote passages from the book extensively including most of the
"Tomorrow Never Knows" (from Revolver).  Beatles provide the audio for the
above revolution along with sonic pioneers Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson
Airplane, Grateful Dead, and front runners of the folk and outside jazz
movements.

February 1981
Phil Collins, ever imitating the artistic direction of former Genesis
bandmate Peter Gabriel with a pop spin follows the introspective tone of
the First couple self titled Peter Gabriel LPs with "Face Value".

December 2003
AndyW, ever on a mission to undermine white soul poseurs Phil Collins,
Robert Plant and Eric Clapton for the sorry derivative fucks they are
plays Phil Collins' version of "tomorrow never knows" for a room partially
full of people already annoyed with his sad attempts at hip hop and social
commentary using vinyl as a carrier.  Somehow feeling this is horribly
wrong and knowing it, Andy is shaken by the glass falling... almost as if
in response to his demonstration of how far a message can be twisted by
sad white nerds like Leary, Collins and ultimately himself.

I've actually met Timothy Leary and he's a stellar guy (RIP), just not too
fond of his writings and never quite understood why he'll be remembered as
the catalyst for the cerebral aspects of the 60s at the expense of Huxley,
Kesey, etc.  I haven't met Phil Collins but he wrote Sussudio and for that
I will never forgive him.

In any case, I had buckets of fun at Sticky... and while this mail might
have been tangential, it's not the worst.

:)

andyw

Subject: [sfraves] Support EQUAL Federal Marriage Laws!

Hello Everyone,

I am appalled at what i've just found on the below mentioned site. Maybe 
it's my own naivety, but I didn't realize that anti-homosexual activists 
actually rallied together on websites to *write to our congress-folk* 
against the very causes which would bring us equality. well, i've revised 
one pre-written letter i found on this site, and pasted it below. please, i 
urge you, visit this site, and email in your letter supporting hetero- and 
homo-sexual federal marriage (feel free to use my letter, or better yet to 
speak your own words against a Federal Marriage Amendment). i think it's a 
beautiful thing to use the very tool meant by our opposition to separate us, 
as a tool to speak our voice. For those of you that I wrote to earlier, 
regarding the poll, thanks so much for your responses. It brightened my 
heart today to see the poll numbers change from 82% against and 13% for, to 
74% against and 21% for, in a matter of a few hours. Please, take this extra 
step to make an even bigger impact, and encourage anyone you know who 
supports equality to do the same.


http://capwiz.com/afanet/alert4171001.html

The Supreme Court of Massachusetts has ruled that homosexual marriage is now 
legal in that state. This means, according the the "full faith and credit" 
clause in the U.S. Constitution, marriage between homosexuals may be 
accepted in all 50 states.

I am writing today to express my support of homosexual marriage. I plea that 
you vote against a Federal Marriage Amendment that would limit the 
definition of marriage to between a man and woman only.

The future of democracy, equality and human and societal progress is at 
stake if this amendment should pass!

Please let me know if you are AGAINST a Federal Marriage Amendment.


In love and light and for the future for all of us who don't fit into 
america's ideal family structure.

Blessed Be.

Subject: [sfraves] new mix: The Control Structure

I swear, I haven't been living in a hole (musically, at least) since the
release of my last mix, "Even Deeper". I've just been slowly amassing a
collection of vinyl so devastatingly good that soon, no tech-house DJ in
the bay area will be able to stop me!

Those of you who enjoyed my closing set at Harvest are in for a treat.
Blurring the lines between house and techno, this mix is deep, dark, and
painstakingly mixed for your pleasure. It's certainly been a long time
coming. Download and enjoy:

<http://alterior.net/audio/shazbot-the_control_structure.mp3>

Featuring:

01. Jeff Samuel - Gbbbump [Karloff]
02. Maetrik - tns-3 (feat. ill73) [Morris Audio Citysport Edition]
03. Mike Shannon - Shogun [Pacific Technics]
04. Rarefaktion - Disto [Click Tracks]
05. Stereofuse - Hot Slot [Salo]
06. Jeremy P. Caulfield - Drowning [Trapez]
07. Billy Delessandro - Mister Sinister [X Force Inc.]
08. Misc. - Fruhling In Beton [Sender]
09. Oliver Hacke - Clip Zwei [Trapez]
10. Joshua Collins - Reform (Rachael Starr Mix) [Honchos]
11. Nathan Fake - Outhouse (Beaty Tool Mix) [Border Community]
12. Smithmonger - Little Sunmonger [Oblong]
13. Maetrik - Freaky Flow (Random Factor Point to Point Mix) [Big Chief]
14. Lusine - Push [Ghostly International]

I'm burning CD's of this one, so give it a listen and shoot me an email
with your address if you'd like a tracked disc with a shiny label sent
to your door. Constructive criticism of mixing and track selection is
welcome, too :)

Cheers,
-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://+1.415.577.3961
  http://alterior.net
  aim://shawnpallen

Subject: [sfraves] RE: Support EQUAL Federal Marriage Laws!

This does bring up an intresting, if tangential, thought....

No doubt the republicans were all beside themselves, and just bursting 
with hate and outrage, when the Supreme Court (just the week or so 
before Pride this year, no less) slapped down those texans and their 
*local* anti-homosexuality laws.  But Massachusetts' supreme court sure 
seems to kicked over the anthill.  Since this morning, we've got a 
sitting president openly saying, to just about any member of the press 
who'll listen, that he'll support amending the constitution to redefine 
gays as second-class citizens, circumventing the advances in human 
rights that have been forced through the courts so far.

So.... if he and the rest of his despicable little christian buddies 
succeed... if the constitution... if the supreme "law of the land" is 
successfully changed; so as to take away basic human rights rights (or 
prevent them from ever being attained), and make sure that it is 
acceptable to treat a minority of ten percent (If you believe Kinsey's 
numbers) or more (My own guess, just based on the number of gay or bi 
vs. straight people I know) of the population as sub-human beasts...

... would gay USians qualify for aslyum or refugee status in one of the 
more civilized nations of the world?  Even before this latest 
maleficence, I've been thinking, for quite a while, that an extended 
relocation to... say... Vancouver or Toronto would be a welcome relief 
from the downward spiral the US seems to be taking.  This latest just 
increases my desire to get off this ride, by any means necessary, even 
more.


cya,
john

my
 > heart today to see the poll numbers change from 82% against and 13% 
for, to
 > 74% against and 21% for, in a matter of a few hours. Please, take 
this extra
 > step to make an even bigger impact, and encourage anyone you know who
 > supports equality to do the same.

> seems to kicked over the anthill.  Since this morning, we've got a
> sitting president openly saying, to just about any member of the press
> who'll listen, that he'll support amending the constitution to redefine
> gays as second-class citizens, circumventing the advances in human
> rights that have been forced through the courts so far.
>
> So.... if he and the rest of his despicable little christian buddies
> succeed... if the constitution... if the supreme "law of the land" is
> successfully changed; so as to take away basic human rights rights (or
> prevent them from ever being attained), and make sure that it is
> acceptable to treat a minority of ten percent (If you believe Kinsey's
> numbers) or more (My own guess, just based on the number of gay or bi
> vs. straight people I know) of the population as sub-human beasts...
>
> ... would gay USians qualify for aslyum or refugee status in one of the
> more civilized nations of the world?  Even before this latest
> maleficence, I've been thinking, for quite a while, that an extended
> relocation to... say... Vancouver or Toronto would be a welcome relief
> from the downward spiral the US seems to be taking.  This latest just
> increases my desire to get off this ride, by any means necessary, even
> more.

both venues are 21 & ova and FREE......

has it... the spot will be on 7th & Folsom.  Call
415.310.8701 for the address, or email us at:
Rumors@RumorSF.com.    We will be going late into
the night. As always, your heart will skip to the
beat of the music & your soul will punish you for
not letting it escape the bounds of your body.
Rumor has it the capacity is 150, so once we are
full, the door will be halted.

Sentient, Obu, Suddenly

you can use the mic input on the laptop just like a line-in. it's got an
auto gain on it or it should... yeah you could buy a usb external input but
that's really for those that don't have any form of input like the iBooks
and some of the TiBooks. Otherwise use what you have built in.

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Presidential Candidate Promises to Regulate Marijuana Like Alcohol

Not sure if this came through on here yet........



> >>From: "NORML Alerts" <letters@norml.org>
> >>To: "NORML Alerts" <norml_news@mail.norml.org>
> >>Subject: Presidential Candidate Promises to Regulate Marijuana Like
> >>Alcohol
> >>Date: Mon, 15 Dec 2003 16:13:34 -0500
> >>
> >>To unsubscribe, follow the instructions at the bottom.
> >>
> >>Support NORML's efforts to make marijuana law reform an important issue
in
> >>the 2004 Presidential election by making a contribution at
> >>http://secure.norml.org/donate or joining at
http://secure.norml.org/join
> >>
> >>
> >>Dear NORML Supporter,
> >>
> >>With the 2004 Presidential election less than a year away, I am pleased
to
> >>announce that for the first time in more than two decades, marijuana law
> >>reform has emerged as a prominent campaign issue.  Among the nine
> >>Democratic Presidential candidates, several have publicly spoken out in
> >>favor of the use of marijuana as a medicine, and three recently admitted
> >>in a live nationally televised debate to having smoked marijuana.  Their
> >>admission was met with rousing applause from the audience!  (NORML's
> >>report in this debate is available online at:
> >>http://www.norml.org/index.cfm?Group_ID=5810)
> >>
> >>However, arguably the most significant development of the campaign so
far
> >>is Presidential candidate Dennis Kucinich's outspoken support for ending
> >>marijuana prohibition.  Last week Kucinich (D-Ohio) announced on his
> >>campaign website that, if elected, he would end federal criminal
> >>prohibitions on the personal use of marijuana by adults, and would
> >>establish national guidelines to regulate it like alcohol.  This is one
of
> >>the strongest and most progressive endorsements of marijuana law reform
> >>ever uttered by a prominent Presidential candidate!
> >>
> >>KUCINICH CAMPAIGN ADOPTS NORML'S POSITION ON RESPONSIBLE USE
> >>
> >>On the "Kucinich for President" website, Kucinich states: "Statistical
> >>evidence shows that marijuana use follows a pattern very similar to that
> >>of alcohol. Most marijuana users do so responsibly, in a safe,
> >>recreational context. These people lead normal, productive lives --
> >>pursuing careers, raising families and participating in civic life.  ...
A
> >>Kucinich administration would reject the current paradigm of 'all use is
> >>abuse' in favor of a drug policy that sets reasonable boundaries for
> >>marijuana use by establishing guidelines similar to those already in
place
> >>for alcohol." (Full text of Kucinich's position on marijuana
> >>decriminalization is available online at:
> >>http://www.kucinich.us/issues/marijuana_decrim.php)
> >>
> >>Kucinich's position acknowledges NORML's long-standing principle that
the
> >>responsible use of marijuana by adults is a relatively safe activity
> >>engaged in by millions of otherwise law-abiding, professional and
> >>productive Americans!
> >>
> >>This is no coincidence.  In the past weeks, NORML's staff provided
> >>"invaluable" input to the Kucinich campaign regarding decriminalization
> >>and the responsible use of marijuana, and we are pleased that Kucinich
> >>adopted many of NORML's tenets and talking points when crafting his
> >>official position statement on cannabis.
> >>
> >>That's right, your financial support to NORML is directly helping to
shape
> >>the political debate over marijuana policy in America!
> >>
> >>NORML'S SMOKE THE VOTE CAMPAIGN
> >>
> >>And that's not all.  I'm also pleased to report that NORML's recently
> >>launched "Smoke the Vote" campaign has so far been a tremendous success.
> >>
> >>The 2004 Presidential election promises to have profound effects on
> >>marijuana law reform.  That's why NORML is seeking to register 100,000
> >>voters under the NORML banner with the online voter mobilization
program,
> >>"Smoke the Vote."  This voter registration tool allows individuals in
all
> >>50 states to register to vote or change their address.
> >>
> >>"Smoke the Vote" is the largest 'get out the vote' campaign ever
launched
> >>by NORML, and seeks to harness the more than 20 million marijuana
smokers
> >>nationwide into a powerful, viable political constituency.  And it's
> >>working!  To date, more than 2,000 NORML supporters have used NORML's
> >>"Smoke the Vote" service to register to vote for marijuana law reform in
> >>the 2004 election!  If you still need to register to vote or change your
> >>address, do so right now at
> >>http://www.registrationbyworkingassets.com/norml
> >>
> >>LOBBYING FOR CHANGE
> >>
> >>In the coming months, NORML will be increasing its efforts to make
> >>marijuana law reform a staple of the 2004 Presidential election.  In
> >>addition to registering NORML voters, tracking the candidates' officials
> >>positions and voting records, and providing assistance to like-minded
> >>politicians, NORML plans to inundate every campaign office with calls
and
> >>e-mails from Americans who are sick and tired of wasting taxpayers'
> >>dollars arresting and prosecuting marijuana smokers!
> >>
> >>Please take a moment today to make a donation of $50 or more to help
fund
> >>NORML's 2004 campaign efforts, and assure we don't miss this excellent
> >>opportunity to make the 2004 Presidential election a mandate for
marijuana
> >>law reform.  You can contribute quickly and securely online by going to
> >>http://secure.norml.org/donate or by calling 888-67-NORML.
> >>
> >>NORML supporters have an unprecedented opportunity in 2004 to change the
> >>direction of America's marijuana policy.  Please help NORML make the
most
> >>of this opportunity by supporting our efforts and informing the
> >>Presidential candidates: "We smoke! We vote! Get used to it!"
> >>
> >>Warm Regards,
> >>R. Keith Stroup, Esq.

Writer/director Denys Arcand revisits the characters from his=20
international breakthrough The Decline of the American Empire.=20
Seventeen years later, R=E9my (R=E9my Girard) and Louise (Doroth=E9e=20
Berryman) are divorced, with their estranged son S=E9bastien (St=E9phane=20=

Rousseau) living in capitalist splendor in London. When R=E9my begins to=20=

lose his battle with terminal cancer, the hedonistic, ex-radical father=20=

and straight-laced son must overcome their differences to bring their=20
family back together. Winner for Best Actress (Marie-Jos=E9e Croze of=20
Maelstr=F6m) and Best Screenplay at the 2003 Cannes Film Festival. In=20
French and English; French portions subtitled in English.

challenge of promoting his film worldwide, and living in Clint=20

set at Mercey Hot Springs.

similar to "Sunday Morning Bliss", which was a giveaway for peeps 
driving home from Camp & Sons last summer, just to keep that afterglow 
burning...

enjoy!  feedback always appreciated.

EVENT:   The Radio Disney Jingle Jam Holiday Party

DATE(S):  Saturday, December 20th, 2003 
TIME(S):  10 am – 4 pm (10am – 12Noon Ticketed-only Event / 12 Noon – 4pm Free to the Public)LOCATION:  The San Jose Convention Center
Address: 408 Almaden Boulevard, San Jose CA 95110

EVENT HIGHLIGHTS: 

Radio Disney AM 1310 KMKY is hosting a special ticketed-only party from 10 am to 12 Noon that includes live entertainment, music, carnival rides, games, and prizes. Plus, there will be a special appearance from the Mayor of San Jose who will lead the crowd to a countdown at 12 Noon to Santa Claus’ arrival! 



Starting at Noon, the City of San Jose and Radio Disney AM 1310 KMKY will open up the doors to the Convention Center for a FREE, fun-filled day for the entire family to celebrate the Holiday Season! Activities include indoor carnival rides, games, interactive booths as well as live musical entertainment throughout the day. FREE parking in the Convention Center garage will also be provided throughout the event until 4pm. 


DIRECTIONS: 
The San Jose Convention Center is located at 408 Almaden Blvd. in downtown San Jose.


   From Highway 101 going South, take the 87 GUADALUPE PARKWAY EXIT, keep going until you see the SAN CARLOS/PARK STREET EXIT. Make a LEFT at the light, then a RIGHT on ALMADEN. 
   From Highway 280 going South, take the VINE-ALMADEN EXIT and follow the signs to the San Jose Convention Center. 
   From Highway 101 going North, take the Hwy. 280 North junction, EXIT BIRD AVENUE, RIGHT on BIRD AVE., then a RIGHT on SAN CARLOS. 
   From Highway 280 going North, EXIT BIRD AVENUE, RIGHT on BIRD AVE., then a RIGHT on SAN CARLOS. 
 


* FOR FURTHER DIRECTIONS CLICK ON WWW.SJCC.ORG 



* * KMKY Staff Members & any additional booth workers must park in SJ Conv. Parking Garage * *

* * FREE PARKING IN THE SAN JOSE CONVENTION CENTER PARKING LOT (7a-4p) * *

breaks CD. The other is from when he played Ascension when Viberation hosted
one night. More on the 2-Step side of things. Still excellent. I have 2
other sets laying around that aren't online.

:: r y a n ::

Subject: RE: [sfraves] what is the best e-list to be on? www.hyperreal.org (RAVES?)
 California

There are a lot of lists in California.  Some of them are underground lists 
and you have to be invited in order to join.  You may want to check out some 
of the forums that are popular (aka above ground or whatever).  Bayraves.com 
is a good place to start.  I kill countless hours at work browsing the 
ridiculous threads, downloading posted mixs, and telling people how 
intelligent they are ;)  Another one you may want to check out is 
Deciblast.org.  It's a bit smaller than bayraves but has the same shit and 
some other features as well.  There is also ravesf and some others.  I hope 
that helps a bit.
-Joey

>Rousseau) living in capitalist splendor in London. When Rémy begins to
>lose his battle with terminal cancer, the hedonistic, ex-radical father

Subject: Re: [sfraves] RE: Support EQUAL Federal Marriage Laws!

Ah yes... google is my friend...  So easy to hunt down obscure 
references... like passages of the bible whose chapter names and verse 
numbers I'd never, in a million years, remember otherwise...

"micromu" wrote:

 > Yeah, there's no gay christians and republicans, so clearly any 
roadblock to
 > your goal is their fault /sarcasm.  Your own hate betrays you, young 
JohnB

Well, the christians wrote into their "holy" book, as a tenets of their 
ideology, things like Leviticus 20:13:

http://www.godhatesfags.com/main/faq.html#God's_hate

... which says that gays are abominations, and must be killed.  So 
while it's possible, on paper, for a gay or bi person to *technically* 
be a christian, (After all, you can't help it if your parents had you 
baptized, and The Church never actually got around to excommunicating 
you.), in practice, it makes about as much sense as a jewish nazi, or a 
religious socialist, a black klansman, and the like.

Likewise with the republican party:

http://www.rnc.org/GOPInfo/Platform/2000platform4.htm

They have written into their platform and ideology the tenet that gays 
do not deserve the same rights as other humans, and their support for 
legislation (And, now, an constitutional amendment) establishing as 
much; effective making them second-class, sub-human, non-citizens in 
the eyes of the GOP.  In addition, a major plank in their platform is a 
strong support for "religion".  And while they are not so un-PC as to 
outright *SAY* that ("religion" == christianity), the implication is 
pretty obvious from public statements of the party leadership.  So 
while it's possible, on paper, for a gay or bi person to *technically* 
be a republican  (Hell, ANYONE can hump it down to the Post Office, get 
a new voter-registration card, check that little box next to the word 
"Republican", and send it in.), in practice, it makes about as much 
sense as... well... a jewish nazi, or a religious socialist, a black 
klansman, and the like.


cya,
john

John,

Your hatred is an abomination.  Leviticus is part of the OLD 
TESTAMENT.  The OLD TESTAMENT was written BEFORE Christ.  Christianity is 
based on Christ, which is the gospels; the NEW TESTAMENT.  Judaism is based 
on the OLD TESTAMENT alone!  <sarcasm>Please hate on the jews equally! 
</sarcasm>

Personally, I'm all for civil unions, and against gay marriage.  Marriage 
is a specific religious term that means the union of a man and woman for 
procreation.  I think the term "marriage" should be wiped off the books 
entirely; it's NOT a secular term.  So I agree with RNC's:

"We support the traditional definition of "marriage" as the legal union of 
one man and one woman, and we believe that federal judges and bureaucrats 
should not force states to recognize other living arrangements as marriages."

However, this is pretty damning: (again, from RNC)

"For the same reason, we do not believe sexual preference should be given 
special legal protection or standing in law."

The belief that homosexuality is a choice is far outdated.. I don't know of 
anyone under 70 that thinks like that.  I'm all for equal rights.. but gays 
have no more right to marriage than I do to a ba-mitzvah.


sarilion

The church and christians are increasingly two different things.  But the
lack
of an ordained marriage for gays is just the way it's gonna be, that's how
the
book is written and unfortunately not likely to be looked over in that
regard.
But what does that matter?  A marriage that's not religiously approved is a
marriage nontheless.

As to republicans, what is said is this, and the rest of your rant is just
so much
banter:  "For the same reason, we do not believe sexual preference should
be given special legal protection or standing in law."  All this effectively
says is
gay marriage will not be tolerated.  That's it.  There is nothing more or
less
here, though you may wish there to be.  I disagree that gay marriage
(legally,
not religiously) should be against the law.  But i'm not overly upset about
the
way things are now, either.  A) I'm not gay.  B) What are we talking about?
Tax issues and the like?  You tell me.  I think it's dumb to be illegal, but
otoh
I don't see why you have to shout fire because someone lit a match in the
bathroom.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Leviticus / Gay Christians

While I have the bible out, I thought I'd note some of the other rules from 
Leviticus 20.  paraphrased.

Anyone that worships Molech should be stoned to death by the community.
God rejects anyone that worships Molech.
If the community ignores someone worshipping Molech, God rejects the community.
If anyone goes to a seance, they are no longer in God's family.
Anyone who curses their mother or father shall be put to death.
If you commit Adultery, both Adulterers must die.
If you fuck your dad's wife, you and the wife die (stepmom sex?)
Father fucks daughter in-law.  Both die.
If a man marries a woman and her mother, all three shall be BURNED to death.
Bestiality = death to man & beast.
Incest = driven from the community.
and it goes on..

When was the last time you saw a community burn some people to death?  The 
old testament is known for fire and brimstone.  The God of the OT is an 
angry and wrathful God.  Chances are you can find a passage or two to 
support any extreme viewpoint.  The New Testament is about LOVE for your 
fellow man.  Christ forgave the "bad people" that the Jew's cast out of 
their temples.


sarilion

Subject: [sfraves] Re: Leviticus/Gay Christians (NRR)

	An amusing Biblical fact is that Lot had incest with both of his 
daughters -- they get him drunk and fuck him in order to become 
pregnant, as supposedly they can't find anyone else to bear his 
children and ensure the continuation of his line. This was the family 
that God saved when he decided to murder everyone else in Sodom and 
Gomorrah for wickedness (including Lot's wife, who made the mistake of 
looking over her shoulder when they were leaving). To the Christian 
God, having incest is evidently preferable to being a witness to God's 
destruction of a couple cities full of people. (This is all from 
Genesis Chapter 19.)

	So it's really pretty hard for me to take what the Bible may say about 
sexual relations seriously. And of course the notion of "marriage" 
being "between a man and a woman" is largely based on this 
Judeo-Christian tradition. There's nothing that says a different 
cultural or religious tradition can't be started now (or hasn't already 
been started) that includes the concept of two or more people of the 
same gender coming together and calling it marriage. Christians don't 
own this word any more than they own the word "Christmas" or have the 
right to require that people celebrating the holiday must focus on 
Jesus and not Santa Claus.

Groove on,
						<<< Starchild >>>
